alert.note: Alert for Oldham; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 2:51PM CDT until June 12 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of the Texas Panhandle, including the following counties, Deaf Smith, Oldham, Potter and Randall. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 249 PM CDT, Emergency management reported a continuation of flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Mescalero Park, Umbarger, Bushland, Buffalo Lake, Dawn, Palo Duro Canyon and Timbercreek Canyon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
